ARB202.title: ARB 202 Intermediate Arabic II
ARB202.desc: Continued development of the four skill areas through conversation, composition, and reading as a means to access culture. Credit by examination is available.

ARB297.title: ARB 297 Special Topics in Arabic
ARB297.req: Prerequisite: permission of instructor and department head.
ARB297.desc: Topics of selected interest in Arabic studies, including travel courses to Arabic-speaking countries. The specific subject matter and/or international component may vary according to resources and demand. Variable content course. May be repeated, as topics change, to a maximum of 6 hours.

ARB305.title: ARB 305 Advanced Arabic Proficiency Skills
ARB305.desc: Readings and discussions in modern standard Arabic, continuing the method used in teaching ARB 201 and 202. Enhances communicative skills by providing intensive practice in reading, writing, listening, speaking and active control of grammar and vocabulary.

CHI101.title: CHI 101 Elementary Chinese I
CHI101.desc: Essentials of grammar through aural-oral practice, dictation, reading and writing. Course conducted in Mandarin Chinese as far as practicable.

CHI201.title: CHI 201 Intermediate Chinese I
CHI201.desc: Continuation of CHI 102 with emphasis on reading, conversation, and an introduction to Chinese history and culture.

CHI202.title: CHI 202 Intermediate Chinese II
CHI202.desc: Continuation of CHI 201 with emphasis on reading, conversation, history, and culture.
